intro: Hyptis pumila, commonly known as the white hyptis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the warm climates of the Americas. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its aromatic leaves and flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and traditional herbal use.
